name: Pain Seer
text: Inspired — Whenever Pain Seer becomes untapped, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to that card's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: Every twitching nerve and pulsing vein carries a message, discernible with the right tools.

name: Painsmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may have target creature get +2/+0 and gain deathtouch until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Moriok see the artificer as a taskmaster, forcing lazy metal into more potent shapes.

name: Pain's Reward
text: Each player may bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of any number. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and draws four cards.

name: Painter's Servant
text:
As Painter's Servant enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are the chosen color in addition to their other colors.

editions.flavor: It gathers hues from the twilight mist so that its master can paint a better world.
This whimsical automaton helps create beautiful murals, then stands guard as they dry.

name: Painwracker Oni
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature if you don't control an Ogre.

editions.flavor:
"Blood flows. Blood calls. Blood devours all and only blood remains."
—Ogre chant

name: Palace Familiar
text:
Flying
When Palace Familiar dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The most profound secrets lie in the darkest places of the world. It can be prudent to make use of another set of eyes."
—Sidisi, Silumgar vizier

name: Palace Guard
text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.

editions.flavor: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."
"I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."

name: Palace Jailer
text:
When Palace Jailer enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
When Palace Jailer enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until an opponent becomes the monarch. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

name: Palace Sentinels
text: When Palace Sentinels enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.

editions.flavor:
"One who ruled willing subjects would need no such protection."
—Adriana, Captain of the Guard

name: Palace Siege
text:
As Palace Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Dragons — At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

name: Paladin en-Vec
text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

editions.flavor: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
"Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
"I do not consider myself a hero. I know only what the Vec teach: justice must always be served and corruption must always be opposed."

name: Paladin of Prahv
text:
Whenever Paladin of Prahv deals damage, you gain that much life.
Forecast — {1}{W}, Reveal Paladin of Prahv from your hand: Whenever target creature deals damage this turn, you gain that much life. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

name: Pale Bears
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor:
"Daughter, on the day you have killed your Pale Bear, then will I give you your true name."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

name: Pale Moon
text: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.

editions.flavor: Denizens of Rath had never seen the moon before. It was a symbol of change, not constancy.

name: Paleoloth
text: Whenever another creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"Gods do not sleep soundly in the earth's embrace."
—Mayael the Anima

name: Pale Recluse
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Forestcycling {2}, plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Pale Rider of Trostad
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Pale Rider of Trostad enters the battlefield, discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"What's worse than being alone on the moors at night? Try not being alone."
—Nadila Maas, moor chaplain

name: Pale Wayfarer
text: {2}{W}{W}, {Q}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: As it wandered Shadowmoor, it did not remember its crime—only its shame.

name: Paliano, the High City
text:
Reveal Paliano, the High City as you draft it. The player to your right chooses a color, you choose another color, then the player to your left chooses a third color.
{T}: Add one mana to your mana pool of any color chosen as you drafted cards named Paliano, the High City.

name: Paliano Vanguard
text:
Draft Paliano Vanguard face up.
As you draft a creature card, you may reveal it, note its creature types, then turn Paliano Vanguard face down.
Other creatures you control of a type you noted for cards named Paliano Vanguard get +1/+1.

name: Palinchron
text:
Flying
When Palinchron enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Palinchron to its owner's hand.

name: Palisade Giant
text: All damage that would be dealt to you or another permanent you control is dealt to Palisade Giant instead.

editions.flavor: Refusing guild allegiances, she fights for those who can't protect themselves.

name: Palladia-Mors
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Palladia-Mors unless you pay {R}{G}{W}.

name: Palladium Myr
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The myr are like the Glimmervoid: blank canvases on which to build grand creations.
The myr are like the Glimmervoid: blank canvases on which to build grand creations.

name: Palliation Accord
text:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a shield counter on Palliation Accord.
Remove a shield counter from Palliation Accord: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

name: Pallid Mycoderm
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Pallid Mycoderm.
Remove three spore counters from Pallid Mycoderm: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Each creature you control that's a Fungus or a Saproling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Pallimud
text:
As Pallimud enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Pallimud's power is equal to the number of tapped lands the chosen player controls.

editions.flavor: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.

name: Panacea
text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.

name: Pandemonium
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.

editions.flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Panglacial Wurm
text:
Trample
While you're searching your library, you may cast Panglacial Wurm from your library.

editions.flavor:
"Step lightly and we might be able to use it as a bridge."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Pangosaur
text: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.

name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
text: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor:
". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme
That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."

name: Panharmonicon
text: If an artifact or creature entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

editions.flavor: All who listen hear their own song, a unique melody played just for them.

name: Panic
text:
Cast Panic only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

name: Panic Attack
text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.
Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

"What do they see in the throes of panic? I'm not sure I want to know."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer
Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

name: Panic Spellbomb
text:
{T}, Sacrifice Panic Spellbomb: Target creature can't block this turn.
When Panic Spellbomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {R}. If you do, draw a card.

name: Panoptic Mirror
text:
Imprint — {X}, {T}: You may exile an instant or sorcery card with converted mana cost X from your hand.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may copy a card exiled with Panoptic Mirror. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

name: Panopticon
text:
When you planeswalk to Panopticon, draw a card.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

"When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

name: Paperfin Rascal
text: When Paperfin Rascal enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Paperfin Rascal. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Paper Tiger
text: Rock Lobsters cannot attack or block.

editions.flavor: The tiger is always quick to fold.

name: Paradigm Shift
text: Exile all cards from your library. Then shuffle your graveyard into your library.

editions.flavor:
"Barrin always said that reality is relative. ‘The world,' he cautioned, ‘is but pieces of one's perception.'"
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Paradise Mantle
text:
Equipped creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
Equip {1}

editions.flavor:
"It contains the wisdom of generations of our people. We permit only a chosen few to don the raiment."
—Imran, Viridian elder

name: Paradise Plume
text:
As Paradise Plume enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, you may gain 1 life.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: A last wisp of paradise in a fallen world.

name: Paradox Engine
text: Whenever you cast a spell, untap all nonland permanents you control.

editions.flavor:
"One look at this glorious item convinced me that Kaladesh deserved my full attention. Sure enough, my time here has yielded exquisite fruit."
—Tezzeret

"This device was submitted to the Fair anonymously. It is imperative that its maker be found. We must understand it."
—Confiscation directive

name: Paradox Haze
text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's first upkeep each turn, that player gets an additional upkeep step after this step.

editions.flavor:
"Keep your pace steady through the haze, lest you step on the heels of your future self or trip the self a moment behind you."
—Teferi

name: Paradoxical Outcome
text: Return any number of target nonland, nontoken permanents you control to their owners' hands. Draw a card for each card returned to your hand this way.

editions.flavor: The results of Rashmi's experimentation forced her to consider the possibility that multitudinous realities existed beyond her own.

name: Paragon of Eternal Wilds
text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Another target green creature you control gains trample until end of turn. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

name: Paragon of Fierce Defiance
text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
{R}, {T}: Another target red creature you control gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

name: Paragon of Gathering Mists
text:
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
{U}, {T}: Another target blue creature you control gains flying until end of turn.

name: Paragon of New Dawns
text:
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
{W}, {T}: Another target white creature you control gains vigilance until end of turn. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

name: Paragon of Open Graves
text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Another target black creature you control gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

name: Paragon of the Amesha
text:
First strike
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Until end of turn, Paragon of the Amesha becomes an Angel, gets +3/+3, and gains flying and lifelink.

editions.flavor: "Let my lance sing with the voices of angels and the heathen cower before my shield, for I will teach this land the meaning of honor."

name: Parallax Dementia
text:
Enchant creature
Fading 1 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with one fade counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2.
When Parallax Dementia leaves the battlefield, destroy enchanted creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

name: Parallax Inhibitor
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Parallax Inhibitor: Put a fade counter on each permanent with fading you control.

editions.flavor:
"The best I can offer is a temporary reprieve."
—Belbe

name: Parallax Nexus
text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Nexus: Target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Parallax Nexus leaves the battlefield, each player returns to his or her hand all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Nexus.

name: Parallax Tide
text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Tide: Exile target land.
When Parallax Tide leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Tide.

name: Parallax Wave
text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Wave: Exile target creature.
When Parallax Wave leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Wave.

name: Parallectric Feedback
text: Parallectric Feedback deals damage to target spell's controller equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: "You can't have so many people living so close together, all practicing so much magic, and not expect some feedback."

name: Parallel Evolution
text:
For each creature token on the battlefield, its controller puts a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield.
Flashback {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Parallel Lives
text: If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.

editions.flavor:
"There will come a time when the only prey left will be each other."
—Ulrich of Krallenhorde Pack

name: Parallel Thoughts
text:
When Parallel Thoughts enters the battlefield, search your library for seven cards, exile them in a face-down pile, and shuffle that pile. Then shuffle your library.
If you would draw a card, you may instead put the top card of the pile you exiled into your hand.

name: Paralyze
text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.

name: Paralyzing Grasp
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor:
"Obviously, the Firemind's mission is worth more than a few goblins."
—Pelener, chamberlain of Niv-Mizzet
The Halimar Sea Caves are both the breeding ground of giant squids and the dumping ground of hardened criminals.

name: Paranoid Delusions
text:
Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Cipher (Then you may exile this spell card encoded on a creature you control. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player, its controller may cast a copy of the encoded card without paying its mana cost.)

name: Paranoid Parish-Blade
text: Delirium — Paranoid Parish-Blade gets +1/+0 and has first strike as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: The mind is perfectly capable of creating its own monsters.

name: Parapet
text:
You may cast Parapet as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Creatures you control get +0/+1.

editions.flavor: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.

name: Parapet Watchers
text: {W/U}: Parapet Watchers gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A kithkin doun is not so much a town as a fortress, built to withstand the constantly besieging darkness. Only those most watchful and trustworthy are tasked with guarding its walls.

name: Paraselene
text: Destroy all enchantments. You gain 1 life for each enchantment destroyed this way.

editions.flavor:
"Moonlight has a way of showing all things as they truly are—for better or for worse."
—Zilla of Lambholt

name: Parasitic Bond
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Parasitic Bond deals 2 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"All bonds are parasitic. Only rulership is pure."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

name: Parasitic Implant
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, enchanted creature's controller sacrifices it and you create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

name: Parasitic Strix
text:
Flying
When Parasitic Strix enters the battlefield, if you control a black permanent, target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: After finding no sustenance on the edges of Grixis, it turned to the skies of Bant.

name: Parch
text:
Choose one —
• Parch deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
• Parch deals 4 damage to target blue creature.

editions.flavor:
"Your porous flesh betrays you."
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

name: Pardic Arsonist
text: Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Pardic Arsonist has "When Pardic Arsonist enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor: Otaria's epidemic of insanity didn't affect certain barbarians—but no one noticed.

name: Pardic Collaborator
text:
First strike
{B}: Pardic Collaborator gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "We've been taught that strength is everything. So how can an alliance with the strongest be a betrayal?"

name: Pardic Dragon
text:
Flying
{R}: Pardic Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Suspend 2—{R}{R}
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if Pardic Dragon is suspended, that player may put a time counter on Pardic Dragon.

name: Pardic Firecat
text:
Haste
If Pardic Firecat is in a graveyard, effects from spells named Flame Burst count it as a card named Flame Burst.

editions.flavor:
"I've heard of putting the cat out, but this isn't what I had in mind."
—Nomad sentry

name: Pardic Lancer
text: Discard a card at random: Pardic Lancer gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: He gets to the point right away.

name: Pardic Miner
text: Sacrifice Pardic Miner: Target player can't play lands this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Punch and drag,
Toss the slag,
Sift the soil,
Leave the spoil."

name: Pardic Swordsmith
text: {R}, Discard a card at random: Pardic Swordsmith gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A finely crafted blade will never meet as many blows on the battlefield as it did on the anvil.

name: Pariah
text:
Enchant creature
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

editions.flavor: A valiant knight's life has no meaning without honor.

"Why would I consider penance for my actions when I have so many subjects willing to do it for me?"
—Lord Konda
"It is not sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."
"It is not sad," Radiant chided the lesser angel. "It is right. Every society must have its outcasts."

name: Pariah's Shield
text:
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to equipped creature instead.
Equip {3}

editions.flavor: To bear the shield of the pariah is the highest honor a Boros can receive—and the last.

name: Paroxysm
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player reveals the top card of his or her library. If that card is a land card, destroy that creature. Otherwise, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Parting Thoughts
text: Destroy target creature. You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of counters on that creature.

editions.flavor:
"To spend your life seeking, only to find regret upon achieving . . . this is the most delicious irony of all."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

name: Part the Veil
text: Return all creatures you control to their owner's hand.

editions.flavor: At the waterfall, the border between the humanoid and the spirit worlds was weakest. The kami moved across it with ease and at will.

name: Part the Waterveil
text:
Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Part the Waterveil.
Awaken 6—{6}{U}{U}{U} (If you cast this spell for {6}{U}{U}{U}, also put six +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

name: Part Water
text: X target creatures gain islandwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: ". . . and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left." —Exodus, 14:22

name: Past in Flames
text:
Each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Patagia Golem
text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.
Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.
It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.
Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.

name: Patagia Viper
text:
Flying
When Patagia Viper enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 green and blue Snake creature tokens.
When Patagia Viper enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {U} was spent to cast it.

name: Patchwork Gnomes
text: Discard a card: Regenerate Patchwork Gnomes.

editions.flavor: When building gnomes, dwarves adhere to the highest standards. The gnomes themselves aren't as particular.

"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

"Just when I get them working, they always start fighting and tearing at each other for spare parts."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Pathbreaker Ibex
text: Whenever Pathbreaker Ibex attacks, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

editions.flavor: "My skills are wasted here."—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

name: Pathbreaker Wurm
text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Pathbreaker Wurm is paired with another creature, both creatures have trample.

name: Path of Anger's Flame
text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Walking the path of the kami only leaves you with singed feet."
—Soratami saying

name: Path of Bravery
text:
As long as your life total is greater than or equal to your starting life total, creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, you gain life equal to the number of attacking creatures.

name: Path of Peace
text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

editions.flavor: The soldier reaped the profits of peace.

"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

"When the sword becomes a burden, let the warrior lay it aside that another with a truer heart might take it up."
—Radiant, archangel

name: Pathrazer of Ulamog
text:
Annihilator 3 (Whenever this creature attacks, defending player sacrifices three permanents.)
Pathrazer of Ulamog can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

editions.flavor: No thought but hunger. No strategy but destruction.
No thought but hunger. No strategy but destruction.

name: Path to Exile
text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

name: Pathway Arrows
text:
Equipped creature has "{2}, {T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature. If a colorless creature is dealt damage this way, tap it."
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: Also called "pathway stones," hedron shards can immobilize Eldrazi on contact.

name: Patriarch's Bidding
text: Each player chooses a creature type. Each player returns all creature cards of a type chosen this way from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"Family plots are so convenient."
—Cabal Patriarch
